      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes(byte[] x,
              int len)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: SQLUDTOutput
        Write the next attribute to the stream as a Java byte array. This method is similar to SQLOutput.writeBytes() with the exception that a fixed length of data is written to the stream. If the array passed in is shorter then the destinated length, the driver will zero pad the array. This method replaces SQLOutput.writeBytes() in the UDT implementation since the user defined type is unknown to the driver, the user MUST supply a length in order for the driver to write the next attribute properly.
        Specified by:
        writeBytes in interface IfmxUDTSQLOutput
        Specified by:
        writeBytes in interface SQLUDTOutput
        Parameters:
        x - The value to be passed to the database.
        len - the length of the destinated field
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • writeTimestamp

        public void writeTimestamp(java.sql.Timestamp x)
                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Write the next attribute to the stream as a java.sql.Timestamp object. Timestamp is mapped to mi_datetime and is stored as dtime_t as defined in datetime.h. It's basically a short qualifier followed by a dec_t.
        Specified by:
        writeTimestamp in interface java.sql.SQLOutput
        Parameters:
        x - the value to pass to the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(java.sql.SQLData x)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Write to the stream the data contained in the given object. When @x is null, the method writes an SQL NULL to the stream. Otherwise, it calls the SQLData.writeSQL method of the @x, which writes to the stream using the protocol described for SQLData.writeSQL.
        Specified by:
        writeObject in interface java.sql.SQLOutput
        Parameters:
        x - the object representing data of an SQL structured or distinct type
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • writeInterval

        public void writeInterval(Interval x)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Write the next attribute to the stream as a Interval object (IntervalYM or IntervalDF). Interval is mapped to mi_interval and is stored as intrvl_t as defined in datetime.h. It's basically a short qualifier followed by a dec_t.
        Specified by:

        Specified by:

      • setAutoAlignment

        public void setAutoAlignment(boolean value)
        Enable or disable automatic alignment. The default is that the driver automatically handles alignment between data fields.
        Specified by:
        setAutoAlignment in interface IfmxUDTSQLOutput
        Parameters:
        value - = true then alignment should be handles automatically. If value = false then no alignment is done. It's the user's respon- sibility to call skipBytes(int) to handle alignment.

      • getAutoAlignment

        public boolean getAutoAlignment()
        Returns true if auto alignment is enabled and false if auto alignment has been disabled.
        Specified by:
        getAutoAlignment in interface IfmxUDTSQLOutput
        Returns:
        true if auto alignment is enabled.

      • skipBytes

        public void skipBytes(int len)
               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Skips over and discards len bytes of data from the output stream. alignment has been disabled.
        Specified by:
        skipBytes in interface IfmxUDTSQLOutput
        Parameters:
        len - Number of bytes to skip over and discard.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • available

        public int available()
        Returns the number of valid bytes remaining in this output stream. This will always return 0 unless the user has called setCurrentPosition().
        Specified by:
        available in interface IfmxUDTSQLOutput

      • getUDTInfo

        public IfxUDTInfo getUDTInfo(int xid)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get general information about opaque and distinct types and detailed information for complex types. Calls IfmxConnection.getUDTInfo(int) param xid Is the extended id found in sysxtdtype system catalog.
        Specified by:
        getUDTInfo in interface IfmxUDTSQLOutput
        Parameters:
        xid - Is the extended id found in sysxtdtype system catalog.
        Returns:
        The detailed type information as an Informix IfxUDTInfo.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getUDTInfo

        public IfxUDTInfo getUDTInfo(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String owner)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get general information about opaque and distinct types and detailed information for complex types. Calls IfmxConnection.getUDTInfo(String name, String owner)
        Specified by:
        getUDTInfo in interface IfmxUDTSQLOutput
        Parameters:
        name - The data type name.
        owner - The owner of the data type (can be null).
        Returns:
        The detailed type information as an Informix IfxUDTInfo.

        java.sql.SQLException
